scriptmanager.scripts.BAM_Statistics

Class CrossCorrelation

  • java.lang.Object
    • scriptmanager.scripts.BAM_Statistics.CrossCorrelation

  • public class CrossCorrelation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class with static method for performing ArchTEx's cross-correlation analysis.
    Code largely sourced from ArchTEx.analysis.corr.CorrLoad in https://github.com/WilliamKMLai/ArchTEx
    Author:
    William KM Lai
    See Also:
    CorrParameter, CrossCorrelationCLI, CrossCorrelationOutput, CrossCorrelationWindow

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.awt.Component correlate(java.io.File outfilepath, java.io.File bamFile, CorrParameter param, java.io.PrintStream PS_CCDATA)
      Perform the cross-correlation analysis from ArchTEx of a BAM file by correlating forward and reverse strand pileups at various tag shifts to determine the tag shift with the strongest correlation between strands.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • correlate

        public static java.awt.Component correlate(java.io.File outfilepath,
                                           java.io.File bamFile,
                                           CorrParameter param,
                                           java.io.PrintStream PS_CCDATA)
        Perform the cross-correlation analysis from ArchTEx of a BAM file by correlating forward and reverse strand pileups at various tag shifts to determine the tag shift with the strongest correlation between strands.
        Parameters:
        outfilepath - the output file to write TagShift-->Correlation score pair results
        bamFile - the BAM file to determine the best strand correlated tag shift for
        param - the object for storing user-defined parameters for the cross-correlation
        PS_CCDATA - where progress updates and raw correlation scores are written as the script executes
        Returns:
        the JFreeChart-based line plot of corrlation (y-axis) scores for a range of shifts (x-axis)
